First, i'm using ant 1.5.4 and junit 3.8.1 (and i have those jars
installed in the ant lib directory).

Now... I have a TestSuite that takes the name of a script as a
parameter. That script contains a series of request/response pairs. I
dynamically generate a test case for each line in the file and add it
to the TestSuite. The name of the TestSuite is the name of the script
file so I can distinguish between runs.

I run this insisde Eclipse and the TestSuite's name is correct (i.e.
it's the name of the script) but when I run it using ant with an XML
formatter, the name of the test is the name of the class. 

For the time being I'm going to create a second TestSuite under the
main test suite and give it the correct name since all the children of
the original have synthetic names and show up find in the generated XML.

Is this a known issue? Better workarounds than what i've mentioned above?

[ BTW... feel free to comment on the way I'm doing this. We want to
support various scripts for different levels of the system and this
will make it easy for QA folks to add additional tests to the
regression suites ]
